title: Job Openings at Kaltani
content:
Kaltani is a clean-tech plastic recycling and waste management company committed to tackling the global plastic epidemic by utilising systematic scalable steps to reduce PET, PE, PP Plastic pollution and municipal solid waste.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Grinder Operator

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled and reliable Grinder Operator to join our team in Sagamu.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for operating and maintaining grinding machines, ensuring precision and quality in production, and adhering to safety standards.


Responsibilities


	Operate grinding machines and related equipment
	Monitor production processes to ensure accuracy and efficiency
	Inspect finished products to meet quality standards
	Perform routine maintenance and report equipment issues
	Follow workplace safety guidelines and company policies


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / OND qualification
	Proven experience as a grinder or in a similar role
	Good attention to detail and ability to handle equipment well
	Willingness to work shifts and overtime when required
	Resides in Sagamu.


Salary
N80,000 - N90,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 21st September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@kaltani.com using "Grinder Operator" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Truck Driver

Job Location: Aba, Abia

Job Summary


	We are seeking dedicated and reliable Truck Drivers to support our daily collection and transportation of waste materials.
	You will play a critical role in collecting wastematerials from designated pickup points and safely delivering them to our recycling facilities.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate heavy-duty or medium trucks to collect recyclable materials (e.g., plastics, cartons, scrap) from doorstep, drop-off points, or communities
	Ensure proper loading, securing, and unloading of materials at our dumpsite
	Follow assigned routes and schedules to maintain timely pickups and deliveries
	Conduct daily vehicle inspections and report any mechanical issues
	Maintain accurate logs of pickups, mileage, fuel usage, and delivery receipts
	Communicate effectively with our logistic officer and site supervisor
	Adhere to all road safety, environmental, and company regulations
	Keep the vehicle clean and ensure basic upkeep


Requirements


	Valid driver's license
	Minimum of 2 - 5years of experience driving trucks, preferably in logistics or waste/recycling operations
	Familiarity with local and regional routes in Aba.
	Physically fit and able to assist with manual loading/unloading if needed
	Safety-conscious with a clean driving record
	Strong communication skills and a good attitude toward teamwork


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 14th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a copy of their valid driver’s license to: jobs@kaltani.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Logistics and Maintenance Officer

Job Location: Abia
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Administration / Operations

Job Summary


	The Logistics and Maintenance Officer is responsible for overseeing the transportation, storage, and distribution of waste generated, as well as ensuring that company facilities, equipment, and vehicles are properly maintained and functional.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan and coordinate logistics for enumeration activities, plan activities for waste collection route.
	Monitor and track vehicle / truck usage and fuel consumption.
	Maintain inventory of logistics and maintenance supplies.
	Oversee routine maintenance and repairs of company equipment, vehicles, and facilities.
	Ensure compliance with safety and operational procedures at dump sites.
	Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, costs, and schedules.
	Liaise with vendors and service providers for repairs, servicing, or spare parts.
	Conduct regular inspections to identify and address maintenance needs for trucks.
	Support warehouse and store operations where required.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND / B.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Logistics, Business Admin, or related field.
	2 – 3 years of experience in logistics, fleet management, or maintenance roles.
	Good knowledge of equipment and vehicle maintenance procedures.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word).
	Ability to work independently and handle emergency situations effectively.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 31st August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@kaltani.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) Assistant Collections Operations Officer

Job Location: Abia
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Operations / Collections

Job Summary


	The Assistant Collections Operations Officer supports the day-to-day planning and execution of ongoing house hold enumeration activities across the state management.
	The ideal candidate must keep good records of all enumeration activities and collate reports from enumerators.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in coordinating and scheduling daily collection activities.
	Track and monitor collection routes and ensure timely pickups.
	Liaise with collection staff/drivers and ensure adherence to company protocols.
	Keep records of collected materials and generate daily or weekly reports.
	Ensure collected items are delivered to the appropriate department or processing unit.
	Support with inventory and tracking of collection tools and vehicles.
	Assist in handling customer inquiries and complaints related to collection activities.
	Ensure safety procedures are followed during collection operations.
	Perform basic administrative duties to support the operations team.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND/B.Sc. in Waste Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	1–2 years of experience in logistics, field operations, or collection-related roles.
	Strong communication and coordination skills.
	Ability to use basic software tools (Excel, Google Sheets, etc.)
	Must be organized and able to work under pressure.
	Knowledge of the local area (routes and communities) is a must .


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 22nd August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@kaltani.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

From routine check-ups, vaccinations, and diagnostics to advanced surgeries, grooming, and wellness programs, we provide everything pets need under one roof. Our team of skilled veterinarians and passionate staff work together to deliver personalized care tailored to each pet and their family.

This partnership allows us to deliver accurate results quickly, ensuring the best possible outcomes for our patients. Whether it’s preventive care, emergency support, grooming, or specialized treatment, Petcare Animal Hospital stands as a one-stop destination for everything pet-related. Our commitment remains the same as it has been since day one: to care for your pets as if they were our own.

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Petcare Animal Hospital is looking for a compassionate and organized Clinic Assistant to support our veterinary team in delivering quality care to pets and excellent service to clients.
	The Clinic Assistant will help with daily clinical operations, attend to clients, assist veterinarians, and ensure the hospital environment remains clean, safe, and welcoming.

	Welcome clients and provide assistance with registration and appointment scheduling.
	Support veterinarians and nurses during consultations, treatments, and procedures.
	Help in handling and restraining pets safely and humanely.
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness of the clinic, consultation rooms, and waiting areas.
	Assist with preparing and cleaning instruments and equipment.
	Provide basic pet care guidance and customer service to clients.
	Handle clerical duties such as filing, recording, and updating medical records when required.
	Ensure a smooth flow of clients and pets within the hospital.


Requirements


	Previous experience in a veterinary clinic, hospital, or animal care setting is an advantage.
	Passion for animals and ability to handle pets calmly and gently.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational ability and attention to detail.
	Must be willing to learn and follow veterinary protocols.

HR Manager Job at Smooth promotions




        
    

        
        Smooth promotions (HIPTV) is a team family organization where we stay true to our values. We are on a journey to sustainably be the industry benchmark for quality and innovative service delivery to target audiences and clients. We also have the vision to optimize stakeholder value by consistently delivering superior returns on investment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
	Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues.
	Manage the recruitment and selection process.
	Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital
	Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization
	Nurture a positive working environment.
	Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance.
	Maintain pay plan and benefits program.
	Assess training needs to apply and monitor training programs.
	Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics.
	Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.


Requirements and skills


	Degree in Human Resources or a related field.
	5-10 years Proven working experience as HR Manager
	People-oriented and results-driven
	Demonstrable experience with Human Resources metrics
	Knowledge of HR systems and databases
	Ability to architect strategy along with leadership skills
	Excellent active listening, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Competence to build and effectively manage interpersonal relationships at all levels of the company
	In-depth knowledge of HR best practices.
